xxl.core.pipes.sinks
Class VisualSink<I>

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.pipes.queryGraph.AbstractNode
      xxl.core.pipes.sinks.AbstractSink<I>
          xxl.core.pipes.sinks.VisualSink<I>
All Implemented Interfaces:
Heartbeat, Node, Sink<I>, MetaDataManageable<Object,Object>, MetaDataProvider<CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>>
public class VisualSink<I>
extends AbstractSink<I>
implements Heartbeat

Sink component in a query graph that provides a simple graphical user interface (GUI). With the help of this GUI a user is able to start and stop the processing.
Moreover, the string representation of the elements streaming in can be displayed. If this sink stops its processing, the number of elements that streamed in and the time spent for their processing are displayed. Note that VisualSink does not rely on temporal objects, but implements the interface Heartbeat.

Since:
1.1

VisualSink

public VisualSink(Source<? extends I> source,
                  int ID,
                  String name,
                  boolean printObjects,
                  boolean println,
                  boolean activateAndPrintHB)
Creates a new terminal sink in a query graph that provides a simple graphical user interface.

Parameters:
source - This sink gets subscribed to the specified source.
ID - This sink uses the given ID for subscription.
name - The string displayed in outer frame.
printObjects - If true the string representation of the elements is displayed in the GUI, otherwise not.
println - If true the elements' string representation is separated by a CR/LF, otherwise not.

name - The string displayed in outer frame.
printObjects - If true the string representation of the elements is displayed in the GUI, otherwise not.
println - If true the elements' string representation is separated by a CR/LF, otherwise not.

VisualSink

public VisualSink(Source<? extends I> source,
                  String name,
                  boolean printObjects)
Creates a new terminal sink in a query graph that provides a simple graphical user interface.
The DEFAULT_ID is used for subscription. The elements' string representation is separated by a CR/LF. The input rate is not measured.

Parameters:
source - This sink gets subscribed to the specified source.
name - The string displayed in outer frame.
printObjects - If true the string representation of the elements is displayed in the GUI, otherwise not.

VisualSink

public VisualSink(Source<? extends I> source,
                  boolean printObjects)
Creates a new terminal sink in a query graph that provides a simple graphical user interface.
The DEFAULT_ID is used for subscription. The elements' string representation is separated by a CR/LF. The input rate is not measured.
The frame's name is set to "Graphical User Interface (Sink)".

Parameters:
source - This sink gets subscribed to the specified source.
printObjects - If true the string representation of the elements is displayed in the GUI, otherwise not.

VisualSink

public VisualSink(Source<? extends I> source)
Creates a new terminal sink in a query graph that provides a simple graphical user interface.
The DEFAULT_ID is used for subscription. The elements' string representation is separated by a CR/LF. The input rate is not measured.
The frame's name is set to "Graphical User Interface (Sink)". No string representation of the incoming elements is displayed.

Parameters:
source - This sink gets subscribed to the specified source.
Method Detail

processObject

public void processObject(I o,
                          int sourceID)
                   throws IllegalArgumentException
The counter is incremented. If the flag printObjects is set, the string representation of the element is appended to the text area.

Specified by:
processObject in class AbstractSink<I>
Parameters:
o - The element streaming in.
ID - The ID this sink specified during its subscription by an underlying source.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - If the given element or ID is incorrect.

start

public void start()
           throws SinkIsDoneException
Sets the temporal starting point to System.currentTimeMillis() and calls super.openAllSources().

Throws:
SinkIsDoneException - If the sink has already finished its processing.
See Also:
AbstractSink#start()

stop

public void stop()
          throws SinkIsDoneException
Stops the processing of this sink by calling super.stop(). Writes the counter and the time passed from the starting point to the text area.

Throws:
SinkIsDoneException - If the sink has already finished its processing.

done

Description copied from class: AbstractSink
The method done is invoked, if the source with sourceID sourceID has run out of elements.

heartbeat

public void heartbeat(long timeStamp,
                      int ID)
Increments the heartbeat counter if activateHeartbeats is true. Displays a string representation of the heartbeat in the GUI if printHB is true.

Specified by:
heartbeat in interface Heartbeat
Parameters:
timeStamp - the heartbeat.
ID - the source id from the source that deliverd the heartbeat.
